main event: A bright light observed in the sky moving with an irregular path from NE to SE over McAllen, Texas.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 30 seconds and was detected both visually and by radar., The object was estimated to pass above trees at a height of 250 ft or less., The object was described as a bright light that was very brilliant., Possible identifications included a balloon, satellite, or aircraft., The investigation noted the possibility of it being a meteor or a rocket body entering the atmosphere.
witness description: Visual and radar observation by the observer.
